title: Strawberry Rhubarb Cheesecake Bars

author.name: Jackie Sobon
author.note: Author of Vegan Yack Attack's Plant-Based Meal Prep, a blogger, and professional food photographer with a sweet tooth.

description: The tart flavor of rhubarb is perfectly balanced by the fruity sweetness of strawberries. Make a double batch of the ruby red, fruit-and-vegetable compote to add to ice cream, oatmeal,yogurt, and more.

instructions: For the crust, preheat oven to 325 degrees and line an 8 x 8-inch baking dish with parchment paper.
In a food processor, add flour, almonds, dates, and salt.
Pulse until almonds and dates resemble coarse sand.
Add water and pulse mixture until combined and sticks together when pinched.
Transfer to baking dish and press firmly into an even layer.
For the cheesecake filling, into a blender, add all ingredients and purée until very smooth, working in batches if needed.
Pour filling into crust and tap pan firmly on a sturdy flat surface to release air bubbles.
Bake for 50 to 55 minutes, or until center is slightly jiggly and edges begin to brown.
Remove from oven and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
For the fruit topping, in a small saucepan over medium heat, add ¼ cup water, strawberries, rhubarb, and sugar and bring to a boil.
Adjust heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Once rhubarb has softened, in a small dish, whisk remaining water and cornstarch until combined.
Stir cornstarch mixture into fruit mixture quickly and simmer until thickened.
Transfer to a shallow bowl and refrigerate to cool.
Spread cooled strawberry rhubarb topping over cooled cheesecake and cut into 16 squares.
Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

sidebars.label: Chef's Tip
content: This recipe is easily adapted for the changing seasons. Try substituting the strawberry and rhubarb for 2 cups sliced peaches during the summer, 2 cups persimmons for the fall, and 1½ cups cranberries and ½ cup orange segments in the winter.
